content.description: This is just left of "Sundays with Noah".  The climbing is very easy until the top out.  It also needs a little more cleaning.  All in all I would suggest this route as a warm up or cool down.
content.location: The traversing problem just left of " Sundays with Noah"

content.description: The whole route/problem is pretty much the same difficulty, the first 2/3 is micro feet and small holds, then balance, and a slope/mantel finish
content.protection: a pad or top rope...make sure to test your tree first some of them are alive and healthy but not well rooted
content.location: this route is just right of Bildungsroman and is separated by a thin strip of moss

content.description: This is the first route one will come to when arriving at The A Wall.   It looks like a stack of pancakes made of rock.   Start under the roof. The initial couple moves are the most difficult. Then you'll move left on pump causing moves and finish with a powerful top out.  The rock here is smooth but gripy and not sharp like much of the Yellow Jacket area.  In addition the climb is only 5 feet at it's highest so it favors the boulderers out there.
content.location: as soon as you get to "the A Wall" you will see this low roof/pancake protrusion...this is the route

content.description: The middle of the route is the crux.
content.location: this route is in the middle section of A-Wall and is just left of the project I'm working on

content.description: There are a lot of moves in a short distance at the beginning but once you get past the crux (8ft up) it is a very easy top out.  This is a excellent route though the tree behind it removes a star.  (you will not hit the tree if you fall but it would be nice if it wasn't there)

Unfortunately the crux is at the top.  It is a sloped mantle.  I fell attempting the move on my first try and walked away a bit scared but was in good enough condition to get it clean on the second go...the ground is very soft here.
content.location: This is currently the left most route on A-Wall.  If you walk another 10 feet to the left of this route the wall tapers down to the ground

content.description: This wall is about 150 ft long.  It ranges from 10 to 20 feet high.  The rock is similar to the rest of Yellow Jacket with some sections that are more featured and less sharp/crystal. The floor is quite soft and mostly flat making for gentle landings.
